title: The Promotion
description: Jim discovers just how hard being the boss can be when David Wallace forces Michael and him to determine which employees will be getting a raise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Michael's office] Could you please sign my expense report?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No way, no how. Expense reports are a day-to-day item. That is Jim's now. I am exclusively big picture, epic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Jim's office]  Sign this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, ah, ah. Where's the "please"? We're not animals.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sign it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not without a "please."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Michael's office] I have a complaint about Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not big picture.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would like to file a huge, enormous, massive complaint about the tallest guy in our office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ... Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim won't sign my expense report.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not- okay- that is day-to-day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, that is huge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're trying to trick me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This has to do-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in Jim's office] I'd like to lodge a complaint.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry to hear about that. Who is this about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Just want to let you know I take complaints very seriously. So... When did this happen?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One minute ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. And how do you feel?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. Did he hit you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you cry?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you feel like crying?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just gonna write "held back tears."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, stop writing that. That is not true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If you stop crying, I'll stop writing it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not cr- uhh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I deserved that promotion, not Jim. Oh, man. Makes me want to put him in a triangle choke hold and force him down to the ground and just keep pressing and pressing. And then flip him over and then put him in a hammer lock! And he's gasping, he's panting! Every last breath! And the crowd is going crazy. And boom! I emerge victorious! [claps hands and stands up] Aha! $18,000 and a chance at the title! Ooh hah!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [at the door] Dwight, Jim wants you to keep it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone, now would be a good time to freshen up, because I'd like everyone to meet in the conference room in five minutes. And I suggest that you bring a snack, because we may be in there for a while.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I talk to you in my office for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm, sure, but could I first talk to you in my office?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Can I also be a boss?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Look, it doesn't take a genius to know that any organization thrives when it has two leaders. Go ahead, name a country that doesn't have two presidents. A boat that sets sail without two captains. Where would Catholicism be without the popes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have noticed that we-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. I've noticed we've been having a lot of conference room meetings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I'm wondEring if perhaps those are a bit, um-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Disruptive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don't think they are. I think the meetings are very important.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, maybe we should talk specifics.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Yesterday, we had a meeting about planets.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: N- well, to be fair, Jim... James... Jimothy... To be fair, Jimothy, the- ah, that sounds weird. Are you okay with being called Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Jim, to be fair, the conversation wasn't about planets...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: At first, we were talking about introducing a line of toilet paper. And what part of the human body does one use toilet paper upon? So you draw a line from there to the other planets, and I think by the end, we all learned a little bit about how small we are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, I agree.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because it's a big universe, and we're all just little, tiny specks of dust.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just think that maybe they're eating large amounts of the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what eats a large amount of the day are naps. You go to sleep, it's light out, you wake up, it's dark. That's the whole day. Where did that day go? I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean on a weekend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How about this? I think our goal should be we don't have meetings unless they're absolutely essential.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. No more meetings this week.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? You just agreed to that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can be very suprising.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I need to fit into my wedding dress. However, I'm also pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know, it's a myth that women have to gain more than nine pounds in a pregnancy. Look at these actresses. Some of them lose weight.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, did you guys register for wedding gifts?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We did, but mostly because people expect us to. We're also accepting other gifts not on the registry... However much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's awkward asking people for money, but we could really use it. Why doesn't Crate & Barrel let you register for a toaster full of cash?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Perfect. I hate registries.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, good.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: My cousin makes the most amazing romantic birdhouse mailboxes. I know I shouldn't tell you, but you'll still be suprised when you see it. You're not registered for a birdhouse, are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, we're not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Good. Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [walks in, see's Oscar, Stanley, Creed and Kelly sitting in Michaels office] Okay, I thought I saw people missing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, just focus-grouping a product expansion idea to these folks. Got one of each.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? Hey, Stanley, what was the last thing Michael said before I came through the door?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley, you don't need to answer that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: "If you don't smell this, you're fired."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Michael, I thought we agreed to not take up people's time with meetings like these.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you mean by "these people"?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, this is a conference room meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, everybody, I think that Jim has gone insane, because he thinks that my office is a conference room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not what I meant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen, Jim, no offense, but when push comes to shove, what I want is more important that what you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I disagree.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you guys think? [all start talking at the same time]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. Guys, can I just have a moment alone with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, you don't need to go anywhere. Anything that Jim has to say to me, he can say in front of these types of people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is not what I said, and, also, I am co-manager, meaning you are not the only manager anymore. I am also I co-manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not what Wallace told us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's exactly what Wallace told us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is not the way I heard it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I love rivalries- Michael or Jim, Paris or Nicole, Heidi or L.C. It's so much fun. But I guess if I'm really thinking about it and answEring your question honestly, I'd have to go with L.C.  Heidi's a bad friend, and her skin is terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is one thing, me giving you the co-manager title. It is another thing, you bossing me around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not bossing you around. I'm trying to do my job, which is sharing your job, so maybe we should just call David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. No, we will not call David Wallace. [Michael pulls out his cell phone] I will call David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: David Wallace is on line two for you guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or David Wallace will call us on line two. Why don't we just-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, David. You got Jim here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey David, this is Michael, senior co-manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey guys, um, I'm calling, because, unfortunately, we will not be able to give out cost of living raises this year, and I know people expect it. However, there just is only a small amount of money for each branch, so we're leaving it up to the managers to decide how to distribute it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got it, Dave. Sounds like your classice big-picture decision.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which will clearly affect the day-to-day well-being of our employees.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It's probably a little of both.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Which is it more of?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: David, I know that I'm very new at this, but I have a very good perspective on how things work.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Wait, I'm sorry. Michael, are you- are you texting me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought maybe we could talk after this is over.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Look, I need you both to take care of this. This is not going to be a problem, is it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it will not be. I am on top of it.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Very good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, thanks alot, David.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Talk to you later- [Jim hangs up] Okay, you didn't let me say good-bye. [sighs, and claps hands once] Alright, I am looking forward to this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You don't have to lie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hate the fact that we have to do this together. I think we work better separately. When I am irritated and I look at you, I don't see you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All I can see is how big and gross the pores on your nose are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Let's get started.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, why haven't we ever, um...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: We have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, there's no easy way to do this. I say we add 1.5% to their paychecks and don't say anything about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you mean, like break-in in the middle of the night and change the numbers on payroll?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we can do it during the day. It doesn't have to be that dramatic, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. You know what would help is a pros and cons list for our options.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, don't take this the wrong way. Are you gonna take this the wrong way?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's hard to tell so far.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You use your brain too much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, are you advocating that I use it less?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sometimes the smartest people don't think at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You just came up with that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As I was saying it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Okay, so for the 1.5% increase, pro- everyone gets a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in nerdy voice] Con- you look like a nerd.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Con- no one gets as much as they did last year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pro- you get to share your pros and cons list with the other nerds.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pro- no favoritism.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Con- you unzip your pants, and you find that there's a calculator down there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've been studying Michael for years, and I've condensed what I've learned into this chart- [pulls out a pie chart] How Michael spends his time. As you can see, we have procrastinating and distracting others, and this tiny sliver here is critical thinking. I made it bigger, so that you could see it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Pam, I heard that you were registered, but I didn't hear where.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think we registered anywhere. We just want cash.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Like money? Like you- you want my money?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Will you take a check?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool. In the memo line, I'm gonna write, "To love's eternal glory."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait til' Monday.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is this what I've become? Materialistic? Shallow? I feel horrible. [looks down at the check] oh look! "Mrs. Pam Halpert!" That's the first time I've seen it in writing!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, the more I think about it, the more I think we should give it to the salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That will not go over well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. I just think it seems smart to keep the salesmen happy right now. 'Course I know that this might come off as biased, so you know what? Let us...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God! Are you gonna make another pro and con list? I'm gonna kill myself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not gonna let you stop me from thinking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! I could not do that, Jim. I can see it in your crusty little eyes that you are going to make everything perfect. If I can just think this through, if I could just think it exactly right, I can make this perfect, and then I can go down every avenue, and every avenue off of that avenue, and then another avenue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And then another-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, you have a lot of strengths.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I do?! Tell me what they are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think that you are able to take constructive criticism very well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha! That- I am not known for that!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But there is a reason why I'm here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! You went over my head to Wallace!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it's because you also have a lot of weaknesses, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, why don't you tell me what those are, Jim? Why don't you enliven me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't think you're good at making tough decisions!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: At thinking out the options, and then stating that decision very clearly, especially when it's an unpopular decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here's a tough decision for you. You suck! You suck! Is that clear enough for you?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But maybe I'm here for a reason, because I might have some good ideas, too. I've been sitting out there, and I've been learning a lot, and maybe I can just bring something different to the table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Skippy, here we go. Why don't you run yourself out there and tell them? [laughs] You call it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [leave the conference room to address everyone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to the camera] This had better be terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Could I have everyone's attention, please? I have some tough news, so I'm just gonna give it to you straight. Truth is, we only have so much money for raises this year, so the simple fact is some people will get raises, and some people won't. Now, what we've decided is, we are gonna give those raises to the sales staff.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait. Seriously?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, you guys are smart, so I'm just leveling with you. I'm just trying to treat you like adults.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you, Jim, for thinking that we're smart people.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But, I do not understand. If we're such smart adults, then why don't we get raises?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Excellent question, genius. It's because Jim wants to give the raises to his friends and the people he sleeps with.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, easy. That's not it at all.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really what it is, is about the money the sales staff brings into the office.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [walks in from shopping, with bags in her hands] What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim is only giving raises to the salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What the hell?! Why are you being such a jerk?!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hold on, Kelly. Would it help you to know that Jim thinks you're smart?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No! [put's down her bags] How is that gonna repair Ryan's car?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is ridiculous! How could he do this to us?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight, you know what? You'd be getting the raise so-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about all these people, huh?! How is it fair to them?!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Exactly!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Totally!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We work just as hard as the sales people. We deserve raises.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes. They don't get 'em, if we don't get 'em!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: My kid needs shoes! You want to tell him he doesn't get shoes?!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Her kid needs shoes, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What the hell?! [everyone complaining at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! I'm just gonna rewind and back off a bit, so... [imitates a tape rewinding and chuckles, Michael comes over by Jim laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was good! That was good! Okay, all right. Well, we all know it's hard to be a boss, right? You know what? Look around you. These are your best friends. These are the people who will open their hearts to you. They all have heart-ons for you [someone growns in disgust], and that is a gift. So in terms of gifts, we should be giving each other gifts. Angela, yes, lend Oscar a cup of sugar. This-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are you talking about Michael?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We just need to hear your plan for our raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My plan- a man- panama.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not how that goes.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You're not saying anything. At least Jim was being direct...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: ...when he was telling us his dumbass plan.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We would just like to know what's happening. Are we getting a raise, yes or no?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright! Let me get this clear! Does everybody want a raise? [all say yes] Alright, everyone wants a raise, so what we're going to do is go into here, and we will not come out until we do.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Again, that gives us no information.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This isn't a game, you know? It's our livelihood!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about a raise based on merit?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Rank each person individually?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. Piece of cake. Ryan, obviously the best.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sarcastically] Well, obviously. Too bad he's a temp and doesn't count, so let's get started. [starts to write on a piece of paper]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you making a-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. I'm numbering the paper.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [everyone talking to the camera] Just-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I don't understand how they can even consider giving money to some people and not the rest of us.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's not like we're not gonna see the checks. We're in accounting!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I am so pissed at this company!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [out the side of his mouth] And Jim!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah. Who said that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think it was Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to camera] It's going really well, actually.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to camera, holds up a bean] Each Boston Baked Bean represents half a percent raise. We each got 24 beans, so the idea is, you place the bean on the picture [walking around the table] of who you think deserv- who's that? [picture that Michael drew of toby, looks like a monster]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's not a part of this. You know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just wanted to draw a picture of him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, your move.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright! Who to pick? [walking around the table] Who to pick?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... will skip a turn.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you're gonna still have to play that bean. You know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need more time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wallace sent an e-mail about a meeting next week. He wants you both to respond. [Michael and Jim leave, Dwight sneaks in]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People are starting to notice how terrible Jim is. It's great. Eventually, they'll rise up and revolt. My only hope is that they do it sooner rather than later. If the people here were our founding fathers, the Revolutionary War would have been delayed ten years, because Stanley Washington was napping, and Phyllis Hancock was still signing the declaration, and Kevin Jefferson was distracted by a butterfly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on in. [everyone looking around at all the pictures and beans on the table]   That's right. Come in, feast your eyes. They determine our worth by putting beans upon our faces.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What the hell?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Things were not this bad when just Michael was manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what are you guys doing in here?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What does a bean mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why aren't there any beans on this very old, frizzy-haired picture of me?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, what does a bean mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was just trying to be unbiased.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What does a bean mean?!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Someone please explain it to Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why can't you? My time is just as valuable as yours.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Not according to the beans.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is how you make this important decision?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's no way that Stanley gets more beans than me. [starts to take Stanley's beans, Stanley swats Andy's hand with his crossword puzzle] That is ridiculous. This is how it works. [everyone continues to argue]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's not so much that I might not get a raise. It's just demeaning!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you! That is exactly- by the way, I would also like a raise.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I would, too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are we idiots? [gets up, starts walking around] What right does Jim have to claim authority, hmm? Is he as good a salesman as I? Is he as matronly as Phyllis? There are moments where we can affect change. For a few seconds every decade, we exist, and these are those seconds! Let us storm his castle! Come on! Tick- let's get him. Tock- let's get Jim! Tick- and drag Jim out of his office! Tock- take his keys away from him! Tick- that's a clock! The time is getting very close! It's now or never! What say you?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I say no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I mean, what do you say to my plan? [all groan] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [leaving his office, hurrying to Jim's office]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What does a bean mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Jim's office] How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, on a scale of one to ten, I'd say I'm about a four.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, what are you usually?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Six. You?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Usually a ten, but I'm feeling like a zero.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, a performance-based raise sounded like a good idea, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We tried to find the fairest way to do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, we did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just- what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, nothing. I just... I used to have to do this part alone, and it was the worst. I have something I would like to give you. [leaves office]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on! This isn't fair!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to camera] Michael's my only friend left in the office. Except Pam... I think. Is she still upset?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [at Michael return to Jim's office] Michael, you cannot just keep avoiding us like this!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Michael give Jim a "World's Best Boss" mug] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's in here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gin. [toast, sip]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [someone knocks] Just pretend we're not here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Heard you guys are looking for cash for the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, if it's all the same for you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Question for you. Would you guys rather have $100 now, or $5,000 a year from now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: $100 now for sure.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Because you just give me $50 to cover the broker fee, I put in a hundred of my own money as the gift...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. No, no, I'll um- the hundred. I'll just take the hundred.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Instead of $5,000 a year from now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How sure is this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The guy has an algorithm to determine the winner of any given college basketball game.
